Module ZiqiYang
Package org.ziqi.control.screenController

Class GamingScreenController

java.lang.Object
org.ziqi.control.screenController.GamingScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GamingScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
GamingScreenController class to register and handle event of the GamingScreen.
Author:
Ziqi Yang
See Also:
GamingScreen

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL location, java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
      When the gaming screen is initialized from fxml file,
      1. Initialize layers of AnchorPane to render GraphicUnits on;
      2. Generate the new level to be played;
      3. Update the screen to render GraphicUnits. 4. Register event for buttons.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - URL representing a Uniform Resource Locator of fxml file.
      resources - Resource bundles contain locale-specific objects of fxml file.
      See Also:
      initializeLayers(), updateGamingScreen(), GraphicUnitRenderer

    • updateGamingScreen

      public void updateGamingScreen()
      Updates the states of both control panel and gaming view(layers of GraphicUnits)
      See Also:
      updateControlPanel(), updateGraphicLayers()

    • updateControlPanel

      public void updateControlPanel()
      Updates the states of both control panel by update information of set name, level name and move count.

    • updateGraphicLayers

      public void updateGraphicLayers()
      Updates graphic layers section for every GameObject of gaming screen by iterate through the level object and calling GraphicUnitRenderer to render.
      See Also:
      Level.LevelIterator, GraphicUnitRenderer.renderObjectToGraphic(GameObject[], AnchorPane[])

    • initializeLayers

      private void initializeLayers()
      Initializes layers of anchorPane by setting its offset and adding to m_LevelPane.
